Core::Thread

Core::Thread Class Reference
[Core]

Flow of controlA Core::Thread is a flow of control which consist of its runtime environnement (data, registers ...). This is the basic unit to execute part of the program. Multiple thread may be running at the same time, and its depends on the concrete implementation of the class. A Core::Thread is also and Core::WorkSet with its own synchronisation object inherited from Util::Mutex. The difference between a WorkSet and a Thread is that Thread has no childs (workset). A Thread inherits from Util::Thread the fact that it is a flow of control may be concurrent with other Util::Thread or Core::Thread. A current running thread of control, for instance the main thread of a process, may be attached as a Core::Thread by calling the method Thread::attach_host_thread(). Each created thread on a node with a globalid has an Util::Object::identifier of the form ((gid << 16)|local_counter). More...

Detailed Description

Flow of control

A Core::Thread is a flow of control which consist of its runtime environnement (data, registers ...). This is the basic unit to execute part of the program. Multiple thread may be running at the same time, and its depends on the concrete implementation of the class. A Core::Thread is also and Core::WorkSet with its own synchronisation object inherited from Util::Mutex. The difference between a WorkSet and a Thread is that Thread has no childs (workset). A Thread inherits from Util::Thread the fact that it is a flow of control may be concurrent with other Util::Thread or Core::Thread. A current running thread of control, for instance the main thread of a process, may be attached as a Core::Thread by calling the method Thread::attach_host_thread(). Each created thread on a node with a globalid has an Util::Object::identifier of the form ((gid << 16)|local_counter).
